item.title: A Unifying Post-Processing Framework for Multi-Objective Learn-to-Defer Problems
item.description: A novel post-processing framework, based on a d-dimensional generalization of the Neyman-Pearson lemma, optimally solves multi-objective learn-to-defer problems under various constraints, improving co…

item.title: An engine not a camera: Measuring performative power of online search
item.description: New research quantifies how search engines steer web traffic by subtly changing results, offering a powerful method for antitrust investigations and digital market analysis.

item.title: Learning Partitions from Context
item.description: Learning hidden structures from sparse interactions in data is computationally hard but can be achieved with sufficient samples using gradient-based methods; This is shown by analyzing the gradient dy…

item.title: Questioning the Survey Responses of Large Language Models
item.description: LLM survey responses are systematically biased, often masking genuine model capabilities and leading to misleading alignment conclusions.

item.title: Wasserstein Distributionally Robust Optimization through the Lens of Structural Causal Models and Individual Fairness
item.description: This paper introduces Causally Fair DRO, a novel framework for robust optimization that addresses individual fairness concerns by incorporating causal structures and sensitive attributes, providing th…
